chapter.title: The Address Book
chapter.para: In this chapter, we will explain how to use the address book that is in Scenic. To invite a remote peer to stream with you, you must add its IP address in your address book. You can give it a name so that it is easy to know with who you are streaming. When this is in your address book, you can invite it.

sect1.title: Adding and Deleting Contacts
sect1.para: This section of the interface allows users to add, remove and configure contacts. You need to create a contact on both machine, remote and local.

listitem.para: Add a new contact: to add a connection, click the button with the plus "+" sign. To remove a connection, click the button with the minus "-" sign.

sect1.para: Next, a dialog will appear with the appropriate contact field:

listitem.para: Name: insert the name of your contact in the field Name:.
Address: insert the contact's IP address in the field IP Address:.

Auto Accept: check this option if you want to accept every invitations from the remote user. This will not ask you any confirmation each time. This can make things a lot easier when there is only one person that controls both sides. Beware that your privacy may be a concern, since when the Scenic application is running, this peer can start a streaming session, and look and listen at what is happening on your side.

sect1.para: On the contact window, you can see a summary of the current settings for this particular contact.

sect1.title: Inviting a remote peer to stream
sect1.para: To invite a contact, simply click on its name in the address book and click on the "Invite" button.

When one receives an invitation, a dialog appears, asking the user if he agrees to start a streaming session. If the user accepts, the streaming starts. This step can be skipped by enabling the "Auto accept" option for a contact, as described above.
